definition: opposite in order, nature, or effect
something of a contrary nature or quality : opposite, reverse
a proposition or theorem formed by contradicting both the subject and predicate or both the hypothesis and conclusion of a given proposition or theorem, â€” compare contrapositive
examples: the inverse of "if A then B" is "if not-A then not-B"

definition: inverse function, an operation (such as subtraction) that undoes the effect of another operation
a set element that is related to another element in such a way that the result of applying a given binary operation to them is an identity element of the set
